result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty. Paul Bucher 
**Clerk inboxed to BC on 10-13-2022.**

10:09 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Defendant Timothy R. Yuds in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Timothy R. Yuds. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
State moves to dismiss and read into case 22CT694
Defense does not object. 
Court dismisses and reads into case 22CT694.

10:09 AM Defendant Timothy R. Yuds not in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Timothy R. Yuds.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Not called on the record.
Attorney appears by authorization. 
Atty Bucher updates the court with the status of the matter. 
Atty Bucher requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter dated 08-11-2022 received and filed. Defendant installed SCRAM bracelet and will be monitored for 90 days.

The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM . The Defendant to report to WCS right after court. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing September 1, 2022. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Timothy R. Yuds in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 

The Court recesses at 09:35 AM for the Defendant to fill out the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork.
The Court recalls the matter at 10:03 am with the same appearances.

Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing September 1, 2022.  This extends to the Defendant's other case 22CT694.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER (Rm. 112) RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP A WAGE ASSIGNMENT. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. 
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
